narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: A comprehensive, nuanced overview of Jewish history from the antiquity to the pre-Renaissance. The course constantly challenged my preconceived notions about Jewish history, capturing a diverse range of rich Jewish perspectives from large swaths of the Jewish community that provided a more holistic picture of Jewish history and its implications for Judaism today. In addition, I found the research paper assignment quite helpful because it enabled me to draw interesting parallels between two seemingly unrelated sources and to think about these sources almost as a scholar would in this field. I definitely honed my analytical thinking and writing skills through this assignment.
I developed my knowledge of Jewish history and ability to analyze and compare primary sources

This course is a broad survey of ancient to early modern Jewish history, with emphasis on professor Marcus's curation of primary source materials. I gained a lot of knowledge about the material, an understanding of historical perspectives on Jewish antiquity, and a general understanding of what kinds of primary sources exist in the study of ancient history.
Analysis of primary sources, and the ability to weigh sources against one another. Also separating the claim of a source from the source itself.
I learned a lot about Jewish Culture and History.
I learned a tremendous amount about Jewish history and dispelled past misconceptions
I learned about the history of Jews, Muslims, and Christians from their origins to the middle ages.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I thought the course was great! Maybe there could be an optional weekly or biweekly discussion section, in which students could engage with the material together and raise stimulating questions to further students' understanding. This would complement the regular course, which is taught almost exclusively in a lecture format.
It's a normal lecture class, with a paper and two exams. I enjoyed the course.

Professor Marcus is knowledgeable and the sources he curates are interesting. The biggest weakness of this class is that Professor Marcus lectures with no space for questions, and there is no discussion section, so students are mostly on their own when it comes to following along and making sure they are absorbing all of the material. I think the class would benefit from a discussion section, or at least more engagement with the professor.
the course could be more engaging. yet I have to admit the lectures were fascinating
The material was incredibly interesting and put together in a thoughtful manner. I would have enjoyed more class discussions.
It was an excellent course. The professor was amazing, the content was interesting, the workload was manageable e
The format consisted of the professor speaking to the screen for an hour and fifteen minutes each time.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Definitely! I would recommend this course especially, but not exclusively, to those who aren't well-versed in Jewish history.
It's a solid class

I would recommend this course if you are interested in the subject matter, and want the opportunity to approach it from the perspective of history, rather than through the lens of the rabbinic tradition which is how it is usually discussed. Don't take the class if you're only slightly interested, or if you need a professor who engages frequently with students.
absolutely yes. as an overview of Jewish history up till early modern times, the prof. was excellent at pointing the major themes, and his insights were intriguing.
I would recommend to students interested in Jewish history.
Absolutely. Ivan Marcus is incredible and brilliant. The content is fascinating . The workload is manageable.
Professor Marcus wrote the book! He's an amazing teacher, and if you take notes you'll get an amazing grade!
